references.paper_title: Emergent complexity and zero-shot transfer via unsupervised environment design
references.reason: This paper is foundational for Unsupervised Environment Design (UED), introducing the core problem and a principled approach using regret as a metric for curriculum design.
This paper significantly advances UED by introducing a more efficient replay mechanism, improving the practicality and performance of regret-based methods.

references.paper_title: Evolving curricula with regret-based environment design
references.reason: This work pushes the boundaries of UED by introducing a sophisticated curriculum editing method, enhancing the effectiveness of regret-based algorithms.

references.paper_title: Paired open-ended trailblazer (poet): Endlessly generating increasingly complex and diverse learning environments and their solutions
references.reason: POET is a pioneering work in open-ended environment design, introducing the concept of generating increasingly complex environments, albeit using a different approach than regret-based UED.

references.paper_title: Effective diversity in unsupervised environment design
references.reason: This paper addresses a critical limitation in existing UED methods, proposing a framework for incorporating environment diversity, a crucial aspect overlooked by regret-driven methods.
